combat.name: Artillery
combat.shortDescription: Standing still greatly extends weapon range based on aim.

combat.name: Close Quarters Shooter
combat.shortDescription: Aimed shots at close range deal extra damage.

combat.name: Defensive Archer
combat.shortDescription: Parry with a bow without risking breaking it.

combat.name: Don't Turn Your Back On Me
combat.shortDescription: Count as flanking partner within weapon's first range.

combat.name: Double Shot
combat.shortDescription: Shoot two different targets with one attack (+2 AP).

combat.name: Fast Archer
combat.shortDescription: Aim as a free action during a Stride (max Aim1).

combat.name: Hair Trigger
combat.shortDescription: Ready a strike that triggers without spending a Reaction.
combat.description: You keep an arrow nocked and ready, prepared to loose it the instant a target appears.

combat.name: Mobile Draw
combat.shortDescription: Move and shoot at the same time.
combat.description: You've mastered the technique of shooting on the move, loosing arrows mid-stride without breaking pace.

combat.name: Overpowered Draw
combat.shortDescription: Each aim action adds a +1 cumulative bonus to the next strike.

combat.name: Spell Shot
combat.shortDescription: Store offensive spell in arrow for later delivery.

combat.name: Tower Defender
combat.shortDescription: Shoot at everything that moves.
combat.description: You keep your tower stance and wait for the enemies to arrive, meeting them with utmost contempt.

combat.name: Tower
combat.shortDescription: Standing still grants all attacks Aim1.

combat.name: Zen Archer
combat.shortDescription: Change attacking attribute of bows from Dexterity to Perception.

combat.name: wip Ricochet Shot
combat.shortDescription: Bounce arrows off surfaces to hit targets behind cover.
combat.description: Through careful study of angles and arrow trajectories, you can bank shots off hard surfaces to reach targets that would otherwise be protected. This trick shot requires creativity and spatial awareness, but allows you to ignore cover and strike around corners.

combat.name: wip Storm of Arrows
combat.shortDescription: Fire three rapid-draw shots at -2 to hit, each dealing -1 damage die.
combat.description: You unleash a devastating barrage of arrows in rapid succession, your hands moving almost too fast to see. Three arrows fly toward your enemies in the time most archers take for two shots. While individually less powerful, the sheer volume of projectiles overwhelms defenses and multiplies the effects of poisons and magical enhancements.

combat.name: Backstab
combat.shortDescription: Add your Dexterity to damage when striking vulnerable foes.
combat.description: When attacking a flanked or off-guard target with a Light weapon, add your Dexterity modifier to the damage roll.

combat.name: Long Knives
combat.shortDescription: Increase damage with knives and daggers.

combat.name: Ready Hand
combat.shortDescription: Draw your weapon instinctively when combat starts.

combat.name: The Edgelord
combat.shortDescription: Master of edged weapons with a competitive edge.

combat.name: All the Birds
combat.shortDescription: Strike all targets within reach simultaneously.

combat.name: Calf Strike
combat.shortDescription: Strike enemy's leg with blunt end to reduce their speed.

combat.name: Follow-Up Strike
combat.shortDescription: After hitting the enemy, use your momentum to strike again but quicker.

combat.name: Mighty Charge
combat.shortDescription: Move in a straight line and strike with bonus damage based on distance.

combat.name: Piranha Strike
combat.shortDescription: Sacrifice accuracy for devastating damage against vulnerable foes with light weapons.
combat.description: You know where to strike when they can't defend. Against flanked or off-guard targets, you may take a penalty to your attack roll to increase your weapon damage die.

combat.name: Tripping Strike
combat.shortDescription: Strike enemy's leg to knock them prone.

combat.name: Two Birds
combat.shortDescription: Strike multiple adjacent targets with one attack.

combat.name: Battle Scarred
combat.shortDescription: Learn from surviving grievous injuries; at mastery your scars tell a story of resilience.
combat.description: Every scar has a story. Every near-death experience has taught you something about survival. Through combat, you've learned your body's limits and how to push beyond them. You know how wounds heal, which injuries are merely painful versus truly dangerous, and how to work with healers to maximize recovery. Your flesh bears testimony to battles survived, and that experience makes you more resilient. At the peak of this conditioning, your body has been broken and remade so many times that it knows instinctively how to survive and recover.

combat.name: Cold Conditioning
combat.shortDescription: Adapt to extreme cold through exposure; at mastery thrive in frigid environments.
combat.description: Whether through necessity or deliberate training, you've spent extensive time in freezing conditions. Your body has learned to conserve heat more efficiently, your blood flows better in cold temperatures, and you've developed techniques for maintaining function when others would succumb to hypothermia. Ice baths, winter survival training, or years in arctic climates have transformed your relationship with cold. At mastery, you move through blizzards as easily as others walk through spring rain.

combat.name: Heat Conditioning
combat.shortDescription: Adapt to extreme heat through exposure; at mastery thrive in scorching environments.
combat.description: Through forge work, desert survival, or deliberate heat exposure training, your body has adapted to function in temperatures that would prostrate others. You've learned to regulate your temperature, conserve moisture, and maintain clarity of thought when heat threatens to overwhelm. Whether from working beside blast furnaces, crossing sun-baked wastelands, or systematic sauna training, your tolerance for heat has been forged like steel. At mastery, you move through infernal heat as comfortably as others enjoy a warm summer day.

combat.name: Magical Conditioning
combat.shortDescription: Develop resistance to transmutation through magical exposure; at mastery resist unwanted transformations.
combat.description: As a mage exposed to transmutation magic and teleportation effects, your body and essence have been repeatedly subjected to magical alteration. Whether through experimental self-transformation, teleportation mishaps, or defensive training against hostile magic, you've developed a unique resistance to unwanted magical changes. Your magical nature has learned to recognize and resist foreign transmutation attempts. At mastery, your essence is so accustomed to magical forces that it instinctively rejects transmutation and forced displacement that you don't control.

combat.name: Mental Resilience
combat.shortDescription: Fortify your mind through mental discipline; at mastery develop formidable mental defenses.
combat.description: Through meditation, facing your fears, or controlled exposure to mind-affecting magic, you build walls around your consciousness. Mental exercises strengthen your will like physical training strengthens muscle. Whether through monastic meditation techniques, exposure to minor enchantments, or simply surviving traumatic experiences, you learn to compartmentalize and protect your thoughts. At the peak of this training, your mind becomes a fortress, resistant to intrusion and manipulation.

combat.name: Poison Resistance
combat.shortDescription: Develop resistance to toxins through controlled exposure; at mastery gain enhanced poison resistance.
combat.description: Through careful, measured exposure to various toxins under medical supervision, you train your body to resist poisons. Starting with mild irritants and building tolerance over time, you develop both physical resilience and the ability to identify toxins through sensory examination. At the peak of this conditioning, your body has adapted to neutralize most common poisons with remarkable efficiency.

combat.name: Waterfall Training
combat.shortDescription: Train under cascading water to resist displacement; at mastery become immovable like stone.
combat.description: Standing beneath a waterfall, feeling the relentless pressure trying to knock you down, you learn to root yourself against overwhelming force. Through countless hours of resisting the current's push and pull, your body learns to distribute force and maintain balance against displacement. At mastery, you stand as firm as the stones beneath the waterfall itself, unmoved by forces that would sweep others away.

combat.name: Ambidexterity
combat.shortDescription: You use both of your hands equally well or equally poor.

combat.name: Double Strike
combat.shortDescription: Strike with both weapons, but second misses if first is blocked.

combat.name: Twin Parry
combat.shortDescription: Gain parrying bonus when dual wielding.

combat.name: Big Steps
combat.shortDescription: Stride covers your full speed.

combat.name: Dodge Behind Your Back
combat.shortDescription: Disappear and reappear behind enemies when you dodge.

combat.name: Dodge-Roll
combat.shortDescription: Roll away from burst and area effects.

combat.name: Dodging Step
combat.shortDescription: Step freely when you successfully dodge a melee attack.

combat.name: Elusive
combat.shortDescription: Each successful dodge makes the next one easier.

combat.name: Footwork
combat.shortDescription: Foundation for mobile combat techniques.
combat.description: You've trained to fight light on your feet, using movement as defense.

combat.name: Light Steps
combat.shortDescription: Step as part of your first attack each turn.

combat.name: Small Steps
combat.shortDescription: Your first Stride doesn't trigger reactions.

combat.name: The Aspiring Hero
combat.shortDescription: Instant perk that prevents death through narrative importance.

combat.name: The Cult Inner Member
combat.shortDescription: Loyal follower with enhanced mental resistance and leader protection.

combat.name: The Cult Leader
combat.shortDescription: Lead fanatical followers who have sworn loyalty to you.

combat.name: The Leader
combat.shortDescription: Lead your team's resistance against fear effects.

combat.name: Painful Parry
combat.shortDescription: Counter-attack with light weapon after critical parry success.

combat.name: Parry This, Parry that
combat.shortDescription: Parry magical effects and protect those behind you.

combat.name: Projectile Parry
combat.shortDescription: Parry ranged physical attacks with melee weapons.

combat.name: Repose This, Repose That
combat.shortDescription: Reflect spells back at their casters on critical parries.

combat.name: Riposte
combat.shortDescription: Capitalize on enemy mistakes with a quick counter-attack.
combat.description: You know how to capitalize on enemy mistakes. In the heat of battle, when your opponent overextends or you perfectly defend against their assault, you've trained to immediately exploit these openings with a swift counter-attack.

combat.name: Plot Armor
combat.shortDescription: Heroic destiny grants supernatural protection.

combat.name: Grip Switch
combat.shortDescription: Switch weapon grip freely during offensive actions.

combat.name: Monkey King Strike
combat.shortDescription: Climb your weapon to jump and strike enemies in a line.

combat.name: Pointy stick
combat.shortDescription: You know how to use enemy's momentum against them.

combat.name: Quarter-staff Adept
combat.shortDescription: Gain defensive bonuses when wielding quarterstaffs and warstaves.

combat.name: Spear Brothers
combat.shortDescription: Fight better when standing shoulder to shoulder with a brother.

combat.name: Spinning Staff
combat.shortDescription: Spin your staff to create a defensive zone that strikes approaching enemies.

combat.name: Staff Acrobat
combat.shortDescription: Use your staff to enhance jumping and balance.

combat.name: Walking Stick
combat.shortDescription: Properly use your weapon to reduce encumbrance and increase carrying capacity.
combat.description: Your learned to use your weapon properly.

combat.name: Predicted Exchange
combat.shortDescription: Your predictive Strike now predicts enemy's reaction as well.

combat.name: Predictive Defense
combat.shortDescription: Preroll your next Parry or Dodge defenses using foresight.
combat.description: You read your opponent's attack patterns, predicting where the strike will come before it's thrown.

combat.name: Predictive Strike
combat.shortDescription: Preroll your next attack using analytical prediction.
combat.description: You calculate trajectories, timing, and openings before committing to an attack.

combat.name: Reactive Prediction
combat.shortDescription: React to danger by glimpsing alternate defensive outcomes.
combat.description: Your mind builds multitude of outcomes, enough to make a difference, but not enough to guarantee an outcome.

combat.name: WIP Predict A Perfect ambush
combat.shortDescription: Your predictive Strike now predicts enemy's reaction as well.

combat.name: WIP Predicted Duel
combat.shortDescription: TBD

combat.name: Reactive Strike
combat.shortDescription: Strike enemies as they retreat from your reach.

combat.name: Reactive
combat.shortDescription: Your mind and body are primed to move with lightning speed.

combat.name: Behind the Shield strike
combat.shortDescription: Strike from behind shield with enemy penalties to defense.

combat.name: Multipurpose Shield
combat.shortDescription: Use your shield as an off-hand weapon in dual-wielding techniques.

combat.name: Perfect block
combat.shortDescription: Make attacker off-guard after critical block success.

combat.name: Shield Guardian
combat.shortDescription: Block attacks targeting adjacent allies instead of them.

combat.name: Shield Rush
combat.shortDescription: Move and strike with shield, adding might to damage twice.

combat.name: Shield Warden
combat.shortDescription: Use Shield Block to protect allies taking damage.

combat.name: Spell Guard
combat.shortDescription: Block magical effects and spells with your shield.

combat.name: The Guardian Aura
combat.shortDescription: Provide defensive advantages to allies within aura range.

combat.name: The Wall
combat.shortDescription: Allow adjacent allies to hide behind you and your heavy shield.

combat.name: That Type of a Person
combat.shortDescription: Rush to protect downed allies, taking their attacks.
combat.description: They call you selfless, but maybe deep inside you are just too selfish to lose what you care about the most.

combat.name: The Loner
combat.shortDescription: Fight alone with enhanced capabilities but no allies.

combat.name: Throwing Distraction
combat.shortDescription: Throw weapon to make ally's target off guard.

combat.name: Throwing Hand
combat.shortDescription: Learn to throw one-handed weapons effectively.

combat.name: Too Selfish
combat.shortDescription: Instant perk that activates when protecting someone fails.

combat.name: Watching your back
combat.shortDescription: Protect adjacent allies from being flanked.
combat.description: You watch the back of someone else. Maybe you are just that type of a person who is always there.

combat.name: Ax Training
combat.shortDescription: Ax in your hands is a weapon of block destruction.
combat.description: Ax in your hands is a weapon of block destruction. Be it magic or thick skin you have the best weapon to cleave through such an obstacle.

combat.name: Blades Training
combat.shortDescription: Be it a dagger or a greatsword, your edge is aligned.
combat.description: First blades were created to quickly bring the fighting to its conclusion. You have stepped on that path.

combat.name: Bow Training
combat.shortDescription: Shooting is not only about drawing and knocking an arrow.
combat.description: Shooting is not only about drawing and knocking an arrow. Well, on short distances it might be. Longer ones require you to take a breather and adjust where you shoot.

combat.name: Brawling Training
combat.shortDescription: Your body is your weapon.
combat.description: Honing a body you had yours hardened. While not as efficient as a quick slice of a dagger or a strike from a staff, you are never truly unarmed.

combat.name: Impact Training
combat.shortDescription: Its not sharp, but its heavy. Heavy enough to move your enemies away.
combat.description:
Its not sharp, but its heavy. Heavy enough to move your enemies away.
Impact weapons don't require finesse, most require pure might to smash and force your foes back.

combat.name: Polearms Training
combat.shortDescription: Staff, spear, or halberd - you made a point where to point the point.
combat.description: Pointy stick or just a stick, it does't matter. You are trained to anyone who dares to approach you, why sticks are the bread and butter of any army.

combat.name: Shield Training
combat.shortDescription: You learn to wield a shield, allowing you to negate some of the damage.
combat.description: You have learned the hard way that having something between you and the enemy is a godsend. Some find it not worth the effort. You know better.

combat.name: Thrown Training
combat.shortDescription: Like a kite in the sky, you were born to move with wind.
combat.description: The whole point of thrown weapons is to be away from the enemy just enough not to get killed. You have learned the basics.

magic.name: Mage
magic.shortDescription: Awaken your magical talent and unlock spellcasting.
magic.description:
Everyone wants to bend reality to their will. Unlike most, you can, because you are a mage.

Perhaps you were trained by a journeyman or master mage, paid to try to awaken your talent. Or maybe, like most mages, during a pivotal moment in your life, your talent awakened.

You might have been a child lost in the darkness who summoned light or adapted your eyes to see in it, a pilgrim whose legs were so tired that all you wanted was for your backpack to become weightless or the mud less clingy, or maybe you saw your loved ones dying and willed their wounds to stop bleeding.

skill.name: Aerial Archaeologist
skill.shortDescription: From the birds eye view you can see the hints of ruins undergound.

skill.name: Anatomical Knowledge
skill.shortDescription: Deduce monster weaknesses through anatomical knowledge.
skill.description: Your comprehensive study of anatomy across various species allows you to quickly assess living creatures and identify potential weak points, resistances, and anatomical peculiarities that can be exploited tactically.

skill.name: Animal Affinity
skill.shortDescription: You and your team have a short window to negotiate with Animals to prevent combat.
skill.description: One day you noticed that cats and dogs love you more then others. Unless on a guarding duty they never bark at you or try to harm you, horses generally don't throw you off, even wild animals don't attack you instantly on sight, and may allow you to walk away..

skill.name: Arcane Mind
skill.shortDescription: Your knowledge in magic aids you in protecting your mind against it.
skill.description: Your deep understanding of mental magic allows you to recognize and defend against such threats with your own magic.

skill.name: Arcane Sight
skill.shortDescription: Enhance your ability to perceive magic.
skill.description:
Arcane sight had its moment of glory among nobles and mages alike upon its invention two centuries ago. People passed the quite painful ritual to gain the knowledge on whom to challenge and whom to avoid.
The boom ended overnight with the invention of #Illusion enchantments mimicking the Spellcraft Tier. [[Mislieading Rings]] are mass produced ever since.

skill.name: Arcane Veil
skill.shortDescription: Skill to hide from scrying.
skill.description: You have learned specialized techniques to mask your magical presence and emanations, making it difficult for creatures relying on magical senses, and wards to detect you.

skill.name: Avid Gosspier
skill.shortDescription: When gathering information throug gossip, your interest in target subject remains hidden.
skill.description: As an Avid Gossiper you know that to gather what you need without being detected, you also need to Gossip about things that are completely irrelevant. By spending more time gossping about different topic you can hide the topics you really gather information about.

skill.name: Bribery Expert
skill.shortDescription: You are an expert in corruption.
skill.description: A silken shirt, a silver sword hilt that isn't an old heirloom, the attitude. They don't need to rub their hands for you to sense corruption. You sense it when it's in front of you, and know when to offer people to participate in it. You know the words and hints to suggest it in the most vague forms. How do you use that knowledge is a different question.

skill.name: Cartographer's Mind
skill.shortDescription: You have perfect recall of routes and distances.

skill.name: Cheat
skill.shortDescription: Others have a hard time detecting the falsehoods in your words.
skill.description: With a pretty face like yours getting away with lying is just too easy.

skill.name: Comedian
skill.shortDescription: You know how to turn everything into a joke.
skill.description: Your natural comedic timing and charismatic delivery can frame some offensive statements or requests as harmless jokes, but each time you do you get the reputation of a [[Jester]].

skill.name: Cultural Explorer
skill.shortDescription: You learn about a culture, its norms, history, and language.
skill.description: When taking this perk, select a specific culture you've studied. You gain knowledge of their cultural norms, basic language skills, and commonly known historical facts about that culture.

skill.name: Enchanter
skill.shortDescription: You learn Enchantement.
skill.description: Your understanding of magical theory extends to the practical application of imbuing mundane items with magical properties.

skill.name: Environmental Grace
skill.shortDescription: You are good at mitigating the enviornmental effects.
skill.description: You prepare yourself and your party for harsh environmental conditions, reducing their effects.

skill.name: First Responder
skill.shortDescription: First responder training.
skill.description: You have seen some terrible wounds and know the best practice to handle them quickly and efficiently.

skill.name: Forager
skill.shortDescription: Procuring food in the wilderness is a second nature.
skill.description: [Flavor text to be written]

skill.name: Fuck I'm Out
skill.shortDescription: Your Initimidation can make enemies reconsider fighting you.

skill.name: Haggler
skill.shortDescription: Experienced Haggler doesn't make thing worse.
skill.description: When bargaining, you don't worsen the bargain on a failure.

skill.name: Heraldist
skill.shortDescription: You have learned of heraldic symbolism and historic context for it.

skill.name: Herbalist's Eye
skill.shortDescription: Gather herbs on the move without slowing down.
skill.description: Your trained eye instantly distinguishes useful plants from weeds and poisonous ones.

skill.name: In the Know
skill.shortDescription: The shadowy parts of towns are your natural habitat.
skill.description: You are quick to know a guy who knows a guy, and as a fella who is quick to know people, you know the code of conduct to pass a message to someone higher in the hierarchy, learn of black markets, fences and other people operating outside the law.

skill.name: Inspirer
skill.shortDescription: After succeeding at a check, you can inspire an ally to perform better on their next similar attempt.
skill.description: After succeeding at a check, you can inspire an ally to perform better on their next similar attempt.

skill.name: Liar Liar
skill.shortDescription: Lying as second nature.
skill.description: You lie as naturally as breathing. When you speak truth it feels unnatural to you. One day when all your lies surface, you will sink. But with your skills it won't be soon.

skill.name: Lock Consul
skill.description: Experience in crime tough you when to go fast as nothing can go wrong, and when to take your time to avoid complications.

skill.name: Natural Predator
skill.shortDescription: Experience in coordinated strikes in the natural environments.
skill.description: In nature you know the timing against your prey, know the best strategies to lay an ambush and how to make a good camo to hide from humans and animals alike. You can use your stealth as the leader of the team to hide the whole team.

skill.name: Not Sherlock
skill.shortDescription: Failed Deduce checks provide conflicting information instead of nothing.
skill.description: Your mind fills gaps in knowledge with half-remembered details, conflicting sources, and plausible theories. Sometimes this leads to brilliant insights, sometimes to spectacular mistakes. The false information should be plausible and based on real misconceptions or incomplete understanding.

skill.name: Potion Brewer
skill.shortDescription: Learn Potion Brewing.
skill.description: Your understanding of medicine and chemistry extends to the magical properties contained in them allowing to effectively brew quickly acting potions.

skill.name: Primeval Awareness
skill.shortDescription: You know of animals' habitats.

skill.name: Crime in-Law

requirements.text: Streetwise 2, Known in criminal upper echelons

skill.shortDescription: You are a respected figure in the criminal underworld, ensuring better treatment and respect from all criminal interactions.
skill.description: You are a respected figure in the criminal underworld, ensuring better treatment and respect from all criminal interactions.

skill.name: Fear Means Respect

requirements.text: Streetwise 3, Created reputation rumors about power/viciousness

skill.shortDescription: Your fearsome reputation causes people to avoid investigating your activities and look the other way when you're involved.
skill.description: Your fearsome reputation causes people to avoid investigating your activities and look the other way when you're involved.

skill.name: Inquisitor
skill.shortDescription: You are a certified witch hunter with legal authority to request aid against supernatural threats.
skill.description: You are a certified witch hunter with legal authority to request aid against supernatural threats.

skill.name: Jester
skill.shortDescription: You gain the Jester immunity.
skill.description: You can't offend people who know of you and your reputation of a clown. At least they can't admit it publicly.

skill.name: King on the Hill
skill.shortDescription: Your criminal syndicate generates passive income as you establish yourself as a significant power in the underworld.
skill.description: Your criminal syndicate generates passive income as you establish yourself as a significant power in the underworld.

skill.name: Licensed Healer
skill.shortDescription: Your reputation as a court-appointed physician grants you exceptional social standing and resources.
skill.description: Your reputation as a court-appointed physician grants you exceptional social standing and resources.

skill.name: Ordained
skill.shortDescription: You are a licensed priest of a deity with official standing and religious authority.
skill.description: You are a licensed priest of a deity with official standing and religious authority.

skill.name: Robin Hood
skill.shortDescription: Your positive reputation as a folk hero or champion of the common people works opposite to fear-based intimidation.
skill.description: Your positive reputation as a folk hero or champion of the common people works opposite to fear-based intimidation.

skill.name: Since It Is You

requirements.text: History 3, Published author, Participated in conference

skill.shortDescription: There is a chance you will be recognized and gain preferential treatment from scholars and nobles.
skill.description: There is a chance you will be recognized and gain preferential treatment from scholars and nobles.

skill.name: Savoir Faire
skill.shortDescription: Learn the rules of behavior in a culture, that is not your own. Can be taken Multiple times.
skill.description: More than 1 is not supported by the current up i the current version. Make a custom feat for this.

skill.name: Silent Steps
skill.shortDescription: Move swiftly without breaking silence.
skill.description: You know how to move quickly and quietly as a second nature.

skill.name: Sitting on the Fence
skill.shortDescription: You know how to work as a fence or as an information broker.
skill.description: You can earn income with Streetwise and purchase illicit goods and information at significant discounts.

skill.name: Tracker
skill.shortDescription: Tracking is your second nature
skill.description: You have honed your skills in reading the subtle signs left by creatures passing through the wilderness, and can do so while maintaining normal movement speed without sacrificing accuracy.

abilities.name: All the Birds
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** +4

Make a melee strike against all targets within your reach. Resolve strikes one after another. Roll Attack and Damage once.

abilities.name: Anatomical Knowledge
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 1

Roll [Deduce] against enemy using Biology or Medicine. On success you learn enemy's weaknesses and resistances.

abilities.name: Arcane Mind
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

Before rolling against a #Mind spell, add +2 Competence bonus to your Endure roll.

abilities.name: Behind the Shield Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** +1

Strike from behind the shield. Enemy takes -2 to Parry and Dodge against this attack.

abilities.name: Calf Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 2

Strike the blunt end of your weapon at enemy's calf. If you hit, the enemy rolls Endurance against your Might. On a failure, they halve their speed until the end of their turn.

abilities.name: Dodge-Roll
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

**Trigger:** You are targeted by a #Burst or AoE effect.

While Unencumbered, add +3 to your Dodge against the effect. On success, move up to half your Speed.

abilities.name: Double Shot
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 4

Shoot two different targets, second at -2 to hit.

abilities.name: Double Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 0 (modifier)

Strike with both weapons for -2 AP total cost. If the enemy successfully defends against the first strike, the second misses automatically.

abilities.name: Drive into Fervor
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 2

Your team are your loyal followers who have sworn an oath to you. Drive them into fervor for 1 turn.

abilities.name: Follow-Up Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** -1

Requirnment: Your previous strike was a hit.
Make a basic strike with -1 AP cost.

abilities.name: Guardian Aura
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

All allies within 3 tiles are protected by your aura. You can provide advantage to your allies as a reaction on any defense. When used against AOE, you provide it to all affected allies.

abilities.name: Hair Trigger
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** Variable (readied action)

[[Ready]] a ranged strike with a trigger of "target enters my line of sight" or "target enters my range," or both.

When any hostile target qualifies, make the attack without spending a Reaction.

abilities.name: Inspirer
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

After succeeding a non-hostile check, you can spend a reaction to give your allies a +2 morale bonus for the same action until the start of your next turn. Bonus applies only to the next attempt, not ongoing effects. GM determines when checks are similar enough for the bonus to apply.

abilities.name: Mighty Charge
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 2 + Weapon Strike

Sprint in a straight line and make a strike. Strike deals extra damage equal to half the distance you moved.

abilities.name: Mobile Draw
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** -

Declare a ranged attack. Gain Stride AP equal to the attack's AP cost. You may Stride at any point before or after the strike, but cannot break movement actions.

Requires: Not Grabbed, not Prone.

abilities.name: Monkey King Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** +2

Climb up your weapon, jump and strike all enemies in a line (length = reach + 1).

abilities.name: Overswing
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When attacking with an axe and the defender declares a Block defense (shield, natural resilience, or magical barrier) before the roll, you can spend your reaction to gain +2 Situational bonus to hit.

abilities.name: Painful Parry
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When critically succeeding on a Parry defense against a melee attack, make a free light weapon strike as a reaction.

abilities.name: Piranha Strike
abilities.effect:
When striking a flanked or off-guard target with a Light weapon, you may take a penalty to your attack roll to increase your weapon damage die.

| Penalty | Damage Die Increase           |
| ------- | ----------------------------- |
| -1      | d4→d6, d6→d8, d8→d10, d10→d12 |
| -2      | d4→d8, d6→d10, d8→d12         |
| -3      | d4→d10, d6→d12                |

abilities.name: Predictive Defense
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 1

Preroll your next Parry or Dodge defense using Perception instead of your weapon's normal attribute. (Dodge calculates normally) After seeing the attacker's roll, choose whether to use this prediction or roll normally.

Unused predictions fade at end of your turn.

abilities.name: Predictive Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 1

Preroll your next attack using Wit instead of your weapon's normal attribute. When you make the attack, choose whether to use this prediction or roll normally. 

Unused predictions fade at end of your turn.

abilities.name: Reactive Prediction
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When rolling Dodge or Parry, spend a Reaction to roll with Advantage.

abilities.name: Reactive Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When an enemy strides or runs out of your reach, make a free strike as a reaction before they leave their space.

abilities.name: Riposte
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When an enemy critically fails on their attack **or** you critically succeed defending against it, make a strike against the enemy as a reaction.

abilities.name: Shield Block
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

**Trigger:** You fail at a Block defense, but haven't applied damage yet.
**Effect:** Reduce the damage by Shield Negation.

abilities.name: Shield Guardian
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

**Trigger:** Adjacent ally is attacked.
**Effect:** Use your reaction to attempt Block instead of them. If this is an AOE effect, you protect both of you.

abilities.name: Shield Rush
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 4

Move twice and strike with your shield, adding Might to the damage twice.

abilities.name: Shield Warden
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

**Trigger:** Ally takes damage.
**Effect:** Use your reaction to apply Shield Block for your ally.

abilities.name: Shoving Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** +1

When making a strike with an Impact weapon, you can declare a Shoving Strike. If you hit and deal damage, the target must roll Endure vs your attack roll or be shoved 1m away (2m on critical hit).

abilities.name: Skirmisher's Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** -

Make a step away from an enemy after making a thrown attack within weapon's thrown range.

abilities.name: Spell Reflection
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When you critically succeed on a Parry against a spell, you send it back towards the sender, making them roll defense against their own spell.

abilities.name: Spell Shot
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** Variable (spell cost)

When casting a single target offensive spell, you can store it in the knocked arrow until the end of your next turn, using your bow strike to resolve both the spells.

abilities.name: Spinning Staff
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 3

You spin your staff, turning it into a blur. Each enemy approaching you gets a strike as a free action until the start of your next turn or until the first successful block.

abilities.name: That Type of a Person
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

When an ally is downed within your Speed distance, you run to that space as a free action. This movement doesn't provoke reactions. When you stand on your downed ally's space, all offensive actions including AOE directed at the ally are directed at you instead. You can't leave the space until the end of combat or until the ally loses the unconscious condition.

abilities.name: The Leader
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

In the face of danger, you are the leader. When an enemy or an effect rolls to frighten you or your team, roll an opposed Leadership check. Your allies can choose between your roll and their roll of resistance. Two Leaders in one team will have both of their perks suppressed.

abilities.name: The Wall
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R
**Requirement:** You carry a heavy shield.

Adjacent allies can hide behind you as a reaction, leaving the defense up to The Wall.

abilities.name: Throwing Distraction
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

**Trigger:** An ally makes a strike, but didn't roll yet.
**Effect:** Throw the weapon in your hand as a reaction. If you hit, you don't deal damage, but the target becomes off-guard against the triggering attack.

abilities.name: Too Selfish
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** -

**Instant** - This perk requires no training. When you stand your ground, but fail despite being a That Type of a Person, you can attempt to strike a bargain with the Master of The Universe.

abilities.name: Tower Defender
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** All
**Requirements:** You have all AP you gained at the start of the turn.

Drop your quiver to the ground next to you. Each time an enemy enters your range or line of sight, make a basic ranged strike.

You can attack a number of times equal to your Tier. You cannot shoot the same target twice.

abilities.name: Tripping Strike
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 3

Make a strike with the blunt part at enemy's leg. If you succeed, enemy has to roll Dodge. On a failure, they fall prone.

abilities.name: Two Birds
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** 4
**Requirement:** You are holding non-light melee weapon.

Make a melee strike against adjacent targets within your reach. Resolve strikes one after another. Roll attack and damage once.

abilities.name: Unarmed Combat
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** -

Your natural attacks no longer deal 1+Might damage. You gain two unarmed attacks:
- **Punch:** d3 damage, Light, Nonlethal, 2 AP
- **Kick:** d4 damage, Sweep, 3 AP

abilities.name: Vanishing Step
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

**Trigger:** You successfully Dodge a melee attack.

While Unencumbered, you may move to any space adjacent to the attacker. You are Hidden until the end of your next turn or until you attack.

abilities.name: Aim
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 1

abilities.name: All in Defense
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 2

abilities.name: Block
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** -

abilities.name: Dodge
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** -

abilities.name: Endure
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** -

abilities.name: Escape
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 1

abilities.name: Grapple
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 3

abilities.effect:
# Melee Attack

**AP Cost:** 2-4 (based on weapon weight)

abilities.effect: **AP Cost:**

abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 2-4 (based on weapon weight)

**AP Cost:** Variable (activity AP cost)

abilities.name: Crawl
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 1

abilities.name: Run
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 2+

abilities.name: Stand Up
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 2

abilities.name: Step
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 1

abilities.name: Stride
abilities.effect: **AP Cost:** 1

abilities.name: Comedian
abilities.effect:
**AP Cost:** R

Whenever words lead to a decrease in an attitude, roll Fast-Talk against GM set DC (based on the offense level) attempting to turn it into a joke. On a success the offense taken doesn't decrease the attitude.

abilities.name: Deduce
abilities.effect:
# Deduce

**AP Cost:** 1

abilities.name: Demoralize
abilities.effect:
# Demoralize

**AP Cost:** 2

abilities.name: Aid
abilities.effect:
# Aid

**AP Cost:** 2 + Reaction

abilities.name: First Aid
abilities.effect:
# First Aid

**AP Cost:** 4

effects.name: Aerial Archaeologist
effects.effect: While airborne you can can scan 200m radius on the ground underneath for potential remains buried underground. Roll History+PR against GM set DC. You are limited by the speed of your flight or flying device.

effects.name: Ambidexterity
effects.effect: Your off-hand and main hand weapons can both be non-light, and you won't suffer a penalty while [[Dual Wielding]].

effects.name: Animal Affinity
effects.effect: Animals' starting attitude with you is increased by 2.

effects.name: Arcane Sight
effects.effect:
Detect Magic's **Limit cost** is now 0. **Range** = 10m × Spellcraft Tier.
You can identify creature's Spellcraft Tier on sight within range by spending 3 AP. You know tiers of spells cast in your sight and range.

effects.name: Arcane Veil
effects.effect: When a #Scrying is attempted against you, roll Stealth +2 against the scrier's Spell DC or Ward's DC. On success the spell doesn't register you.

effects.name: Artillery
effects.effect: As long as you didn't move this or previous turn, your weapon range = Aim, double your aim X.

effects.name: Avid Gossiper
effects.effect: When gathering information, you can choose to spend double the time to do so covertly. When you do, roll Gossip +5 against the highest level of target who is actively conducting counter intelligence.

effects.name: Backstab
effects.effect: When attacking a flanked or off-guard target with a Light weapon, add your Dexterity to the damage roll.

effects.name: Battle Scarred
effects.effect:
Your body bears the marks of countless battles. Through experience with injury and recovery, you've learned how to survive grievous wounds.

**Effect:** Reduce the Treatment DC for healing your wounds by 2 (makes it easier for others to treat your injuries).

effects.name: Big Steps
effects.effect: While Unencumbered, you can Stride up to your full Speed instead of half.

effects.name: Bribery Expert
effects.effect: You can deduce if an official is corruptible or if you can ask for a bribe with +3. You know appropriate amounts for different 'favors'.

effects.name: Cartographer's Mind
effects.effect:
- Recall without a roll all roads and routes you have taken during the last month.
- During downtime, can create accurate maps of traveled areas.
- Perfect memory includes landmarks, distances, and navigation details.

effects.name: Cheat
effects.effect: When someone with neutral or better attitude that might find you attractive rolls to Detect Falsehood, they roll with #Disadvantage.

effects.name: Close Quarters Shooter
effects.effect: When you aim, but strike a target within your close range your attack deals extra damage equal to your archery level.

effects.name: Cold Conditioning
effects.effect:
Through prolonged exposure to frigid temperatures, your body has adapted to function efficiently in extreme cold.

**Effect:**
- Gain +2 bonus to Endure checks against cold effects
- Treat cold environments as one step less severe (extreme cold becomes severe, severe becomes moderate, etc.)

effects.name: Crime in-Law
effects.effect:
- +2 bonus to all interactions with criminals and criminal organizations
- Recognized status in the criminal hierarchy provides protection and respect
- Better treatment in criminal-controlled areas (better accommodations, respect)
- May provide protection from lower-level criminals who wouldn't dare cross you
- Access to higher-level criminal operations and information
- Can mediate disputes between criminal factions
- Status must be maintained through actions and reputation
- May create enemies among law enforcement and rival criminal organizations
- Particularly useful for large-scale criminal operations and underworld politics

effects.name: Cultural Explorer
effects.effect:
- Choose one specific culture when taking this perk
- Learn cultural norms, social expectations, and taboos
- Gain basic language skills for communication
- Know commonly known historical facts and cultural references
- Can take this perk multiple times for different cultures

effects.name: Defensive Archer
effects.effect: You can parry with a bow without risking to break it.

effects.name: Defensive Stance
effects.effect: When using the Ready action to prepare a weapon strike with a polearm, reduce the AP cost by 1 (minimum 1 AP).

effects.name: Dodging Step
effects.effect: While Unencumbered, when you successfully Dodge a melee attack, make a free Step within the attacker's reach.

effects.name: Don't Turn Your Back On Me
effects.effect: You count as a flanking partner within range of your weapon, as if your range was your reach.

effects.name: Elusive
effects.effect: While Unencumbered, each successful Dodge gives +1 to Dodge until the start of your next turn. Stacks.

effects.name: Enchanter
effects.effect: #TODO Enchantment (crafting) rules are TBD in 0.8 or later.

effects.name: Enhanced Defensive Stance
effects.effect:
**Requirement**: Your weapon is a polearm that deals piercing or slashing damage.
Attacks dealt as a reaction to enemy movement deal extra damage of 2 per damage die.

effects.name: Enhanced Knives
effects.effect: Increase the die size of Knives and daggers in your hands by 1 step.

effects.name: Environmental Grace
effects.effect:
- Reduce harsh environmental effects by 1 step for you and your party
- Applies to temperature extremes, altitude effects, and similar natural hazards

effects.name: Expanded Blade Critical Range
effects.effect: When attacking with blades, exceeding the defense roll by 10 or more counts as a critical hit.

effects.name: Extra HP
effects.effect:
Gain additional HP based on your current Max_Wounds.

This effect is granted by leveled conditioning perks (Poison Resistance, Waterfall Training, Mental Resilience, Cold Conditioning, Heat Conditioning, Battle Scarred, and Magical Conditioning).

**Progression:**
- **Levels 1-4:** Gain +1 HP per level
- **Level 5:** Consolidates into +1 Max_Wounds (the new wound grants full armor and endurance bonuses)

effects.name: Fast Archer
effects.effect: You can aim as a free action while you move to a maximum of Aim1.

effects.name: Fear Means Respect
effects.effect:
- People will ignore or avoid investigating activities they believe you're involved in
- Information gathering attempts about you must overcome fear with DC based on reputation strength
- Reputation rumors have their own DC system (to be detailed later)
- Takes a hero-level character to openly stand against your reputation
- Does not protect against direct evidence or witnesses to major crimes
- May cause innocent people to be too afraid to interact with you normally
- Can backfire if reputation is exposed as false or if defeated publicly
- Requires maintaining the fearsome image through actions or continued rumors
- Particularly effective for intimidation-based criminal operations

effects.name: First Responder
effects.effect: When rolling for first aid as the first responder (first attempt at first aid) on the target, calculate the Treatment DC as 10 + (Consequence/20). First Aid AP cost reduced to 3.

effects.name: Flanked
effects.effect:
Enemies surround you in an angle of 135* or more.
![[Flanking Rules]]
you gain ![[Condition - Off Guard||Off Guard Condition]]

effects.name: Footwork
effects.effect: While Unencumbered, gain +1 to all defenses.

effects.name: Forager
effects.effect: When traveling long distances in environments with present food sources you can procure 4 + Skill rations without considerably slowing down. Based on the environment GM determines food availability. (#TODO update when exploration rules are written)

effects.name: Fuck I'm Out
effects.effect: Mindful enemies that think they are weaker than you have to roll the second endure check against your DC or disengage for 1 round. GM decides if they will return to combat at all.

effects.name: Grabbed
effects.effect: You are held in place by another creature through a grapple.

effects.name: Grip Switch
effects.effect: Switch the grip between long reach and reach for free at the beginning of an offensive action.

effects.name: Haggler
effects.effect: When you fail bargaining check as per [[Trading Rules]], don't worsen the deal.

effects.name: Heat Conditioning
effects.effect:
Through prolonged exposure to scorching temperatures, your body has adapted to function efficiently in extreme heat.

**Effect:**
- Gain +2 bonus to Endure checks against heat effects
- Treat heat environments as one step less severe (extreme heat becomes severe, severe becomes moderate, etc.)

effects.name: Heraldist
effects.effect:
When trying to identify heraldry you roll deduce with +2 competency bonus.
When identifying unknown heraldics, you can attempt to deduce the symbolism attached,

effects.name: Herbalist's Eye
effects.effect:
When foraging for herbs while marching, choose one:
1. Ignore the –1 Speed penalty for gathering on the move.
2. Ignore the +2 DC penalty for gathering on the move.

effects.name: In the Know
effects.effect:
- Spending one week of downtime in a settlement you get the initial set of connections.
- May provide access to black market, information brokers, and fixers, as well as criminal and low profile contracts.

effects.name: Inquisitor
effects.effect:
- Certified witch hunter with official recognition
- Can legally request local authorities provide aid or rewards against supernatural threats
- Authority extends to non-hostile religious jurisdictions
- Requires valid proof or prior notification to authorities
- Can pursue supernatural threats that weren't initially requested to be removed
- May requisition resources, manpower, or information for investigations
- Legal protection when acting within authority against supernatural threats
- Can identify and classify various supernatural entities and their threat levels
- May coordinate with other religious organizations for major threats

effects.name: Jester
effects.effect: You are a jester. Enjoy yourself.

effects.name: King on the Hill
effects.effect:
- Criminal organization generates passive income during downtime
- Income amount determined by organization size, territory, and activities
- Requires ongoing management and decision-making to maintain profitability
- May involve protection rackets, smuggling, fencing operations, etc.
- Organization can provide resources, information, and manpower
- Attracts attention from law enforcement and rival criminal groups
- Income may fluctuate based on successful operations and external threats
- Can be expanded through successful criminal ventures and territorial expansion
- Provides foundation for major criminal storylines and campaigns

effects.name: Liar Liar
effects.effect:
- +2 bonus on all fast talk and manipulation rolls in attempts to mislead
- -2 penalty on leadership and negotiation checks if you are honest
- Penalty applies when genuine honesty and sincerity are required

effects.name: Licensed Healer
effects.effect:
- Gain audiences with nobility through your medical standing
- Protection under medical immunity laws when practicing medicine
- Access to rare ingredients through royal connections and court resources
- Preferential treatment in legal and social situations
- May be called upon to treat important political figures
- Access to court libraries, laboratories, and medical facilities
- Political influence through medical services to the powerful
- Requires maintaining court appointment through continued service

effects.name: Light Steps
effects.effect: While Unencumbered, make a Step as part of your first attack each turn. You can Step before or after the strike.

effects.name: Lock Consul
effects.effect:
When circumventing locks or safes, you can adjust your approach:

1. **Quick and Dirty:** Reduce the **attempt time** by 1 step (Shift → Breather → Minuta), but increase the **DC by 2**.
    
2. **Slow and Steady:** Ignore the normal **failure effect**, and treat **critical failure** as a simple failure

effects.name: Mage
effects.effect:
- Select one Tier 0 spell and add it to your repertoire (this spell doesn't contribute to attribute advancement)
- You unlock Tier 0 spells for learning
- You can learn Team Ritual in one day with written guidance or one shift with help
- This perk requires GM permission and no time to learn
- Can be selected as part of character background (GM may require Magical Theory 1/Theology 1 and a magical instructor)

effects.name: Magical Conditioning
effects.effect:
Through repeated exposure to transmutation magic and teleportation effects, your body and essence have developed resistance to forced magical alterations.

**Effect:** Gain +2 bonus to resist transmutation spells and forced teleportation effects.

effects.name: Magical Deflection
effects.effect: You can parry Lines, Rays, Bursts and Cones. On a successful parry, targets behind you are unaffected.

effects.name: Mental Resilience
effects.effect:
Through meditation, mental exercises, or exposure to mind-affecting magic, you have fortified your will against mental intrusion.

**Effect:** Gain +2 bonus to Endure checks against mental effects (fear, charm, mind control, and similar mind-affecting abilities).

effects.name: Multipurpose Shield
effects.effect: Shield counts as a weapon for dual wielding.

effects.name: Natural Predator
effects.effect: When laying ambush, or attempting to attack a target you are tracking you can use Tracking, Stealth or Survival for the initiative as the leader of the Ambush.

effects.name: Not Sherlock
effects.effect: When you fail a [Deduce] check, the GM provides two pieces of information: one true, one false. You don't know which is which.

effects.name: Ordained
effects.effect:
- Licensed priest status with legal religious authority
- Can seek refuge and gain preferential treatment at churches of your deity
- Know the tenets, rites, and ceremonies of your chosen deity
- Authority to perform religious ceremonies: weddings, funerals, blessings
- May provide spiritual counsel and religious guidance to followers
- Access to religious networks and communication channels
- Protection under religious law in many jurisdictions
- Can identify religious symbols, practices, and beliefs of your faith
- May be called upon to resolve religious disputes or provide guidance

effects.name: Overpowered Draw
effects.effect: Each aim action adds a +1 cumulative to the next strike.

effects.name: Perfect Block
effects.effect: When critically succeeding on a Block defense against a melee attack, the attacker becomes off-guard until the start of their next turn.

effects.name: Plot Armor
effects.effect: You are the shining hope, the hero with a destiny. You gain Plot Armor.

effects.name: Poison Resistance
effects.effect:
Through constant exposure to small doses of various toxins, you have developed a remarkable resistance to poisons.

**Effect:** Gain +2 bonus to Endure checks against poison effects.

effects.name: Potion Brewer
effects.effect: #TODO Potion Brewing (crafting) rules are TBD in 0.8 or later.

effects.name: Predicted Exchange
effects.effect: When using [[Predictive Strike]] roll the enemy's defense as well. This predicts the rolls, but doesn't prevent enemy to use reactions and other abilities and effects to modify the end result.

effects.name: Primeval Awareness
effects.effect: While foraging, hunting or tracking in the wilderness roll Survival to notice subtle things animals and beasts in passing, identifying the common ones without a roll. You still need [Deduce] to identify rarer species.

effects.name: Projectile Deflection
effects.effect: You can use Parry defense against ranged physical attacks (arrows, thrown weapons, etc.) using a melee weapon.

effects.name: Quarterstaff Defense
effects.effect: Quarterstaff and WarStaves in your hands grant you +1 to all defenses.

effects.name: Ready Hand
effects.effect: You were trained to take out your weapon instinctually. On initiative, even when ambushed, draw your blade.

effects.name: Robin Hood
effects.effect:
- Similar mechanics to "Fear Means Respect" but based on positive reputation
- People will help cover for you or provide assistance believing you're fighting for good
- Information gathering about your activities faces resistance from sympathetic population
- Common folk may actively hinder authorities investigating you
- Provides protection through popular support rather than fear
- May attract followers, informants, and allies to your cause
- Can backfire if your actions contradict the heroic reputation
- Requires maintaining the positive image through charitable or heroic actions
- Particularly effective for rebellion-based storylines and protecting the innocent

effects.name: Savoir Faire
effects.effect: Knowledge of the appropriate behavior in a subculture that has an established code of conduct. Basically you know the rules of said specific society.

effects.name: Second Reaction
effects.effect: You gain a second reaction.

effects.name: Since It Is You
effects.effect:
- Recognition chance in academic and noble circles
- Preferential treatment may include offers of accommodation, audiences, or access
- Based on your published works and conference participation
- May open doors to private libraries, exclusive events, or scholarly discussions
- Recognition depends on local scholarly community and your reputation
- Can provide opportunities for funding, patronage, or collaboration
- May attract requests for lectures, consultations, or expert opinions
- Requires maintaining scholarly reputation through continued work
- Particularly useful for accessing exclusive knowledge or influential contacts

effects.name: Sitting on the Fence
Small Steps
effects.effect: While Unencumbered, your first Stride each turn doesn't trigger reactions (except readied actions).

effects.name: Spear Brothers
effects.effect: When standing adjacent to another spearman with this perk, you gain +1 Situational bonus to Parrying, and, +1 Situational bonus to strikes if the enemy is within the reach of both of you.

effects.name: Spell Guard
effects.effect: You learn to channel magical energy through your shield, creating a defensive layer covering you. You can attempt to Block against Physical or Energy Line, Cone, Burst, and Ray type spells and magical effects (like dragon's breath or fireball). If you have Guardian Aura, the bonus applies to your allies as well.

effects.name: Staff Acrobat
effects.effect: Add your weapon's reach to the distance of your long jumps, and half of it to your high jumps. While holding your staff, you get +2 on checks to balance.

effects.name: The Aspiring Hero
effects.effect: This perk requires no training. If you die here, the story ends. Lose 10 CP, take a limitation, consequence, or disadvantage of GM's choice and survive.

effects.name: The Cult Inner Member
effects.effect: You are close to The Leader and your oath is strong. Any attempt to mind control or coerce you (unless by the leader) is rolled with disadvantage. You gain "Protect the Leader" reaction (allowing you to take damage for the leader if adjacent). When driven into fervor, your attack increases by +2 and defense decreases by -3.

effects.name: The Edgelord
effects.effect: You are so edgy one can cut themselves against you. Deal +2 damage with edged weapons. If two Edgelords exist in one party, they must duel. The winner keeps the perk, the loser loses the edge.

effects.name: The Loner
effects.effect: It's you against the world. When fighting alone you start with +2 AP. You count no-one as your allies. You can't be a willing target for a Team Ritual, if you participate in one you lose this effect until you are no longer connected for over a day. Retraining from this perk requires GM permission. (and a story arc)

effects.name: Throwing Hand
effects.effect: You learn how to throw 1H weapons. If it's a thrown weapon, increase the range by 3, if not, range becomes 3. Use Dexterity for thrown attacks.

effects.name: Tower
effects.effect: As long as you didn't move previous and this turns - all your attacks are getting Aim1.

effects.name: Tracker
effects.effect: When tracking you don't reduce movement speed.

effects.name: Twin Parry
effects.effect: Dual wielding provides +1 circumstance bonus to parrying.

effects.name: Vanishing Step
effects.effect: When using Dodging Step and succeeding on your dodge, roll Stealth against enemy's Perception. If you succeed, you are hidden from that enemy and appear behind their back.

effects.name: Walking Stick
effects.effect: Your Heavy Polearms don't count towards your encumbrance, and Light and Medium Polearms provide you with extra carrying weight.

effects.name: Wargame Master
effects.effect:
- When others are participating in War-Games you organize, they will perceive it as more real, allowing them to earn experience at a speed they would earn in a real battle.
- If you are [System Authorized Event Manager] You can register said events with the system for tracking and rewards.
- Your senses [Perception] will be enhanced by +1, when attempting to find foul play during all of your events.

effects.name: Watching your back
effects.effect: While adjacent to you your allies cannot be flanked. Because you always are watching their backs.

effects.name: Waterfall Training
effects.effect:
Through rigorous training under cascading water and resisting powerful currents, you've learned to stand firm against forces that would move you.

**Effect:** Gain +2 bonus to resist forced movement effects (pushes, pulls, trips, and similar displacement effects).

effects.name: Zen Archer
effects.effect: You can change the attacking attribute of the bow from Dexterity to Perception.
